Title: RHSA-2019:2294: libvirt security, bug fix, and enhancement update (Moderate)
Description:
The libvirt library contains a C API for managing and interacting with the virtualization capabilities of Linux and other operating systems. In addition, libvirt provides tools for remote management of virtualized systems.

Security Fix(es):

* libvirt: NULL pointer dereference after running qemuAgentCommand in qemuAgentGetInterfaces function (CVE-2019-3840)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.7 Release Notes linked from the References section.

Bugzillas.Title: Race starting multiple libvirtd user sessions at the same time
Enhance detection of host CPU model to avoid guesses based on fea.ture list length
[RFE] Add functionality to virsh to mount nfs shares using commands like mountvers, nosuid, nodev.
Cannot use a xml file with XML declaration as a input of cpu-compare
virt-xml-validate validate fails for volume having backing file
nwfilter-binding-create succeed on interface which does not exist
Starting VM without source configured for pci-serial device caused libvirtd crash
Wrong RESUME event after I/O error
Allow the inputvol to be encrypted when creating a volume from another volume
Improve --adapter-parent-wwnn,--adapter-parent-wwpn and --adapter-parent-fabric-wwn info for pool-define-as in man page
libvirt uses incorrect method to detect that KVM is working
Permission denied when start guest with egl-headless display
Create luks vol failed when give the user access control for storage-vol API
guest with an interface referred to nwfilter killed by libvirt when restart libvirtd with access driver enabled
scsi host device passthrough limits IO writes
domxml-to-native should treat --xml as the default option
libvirt creating qemu channels with the wrong permissions
[RHHI] Hosted Engine migration fails in gluster storage domain
check tsc scaling fea-ture of destination host on migration
VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_POSTCOPY is never used in postcopy migration
when create vhba without indicating wwpn/wwnn, libvirt will generate duplicated ones
when <shareable/> removed from scsi hostdev xml, related chardev's unpriv_sgio not set back to zero.
different behaviors when create storage pool via NPIV in RHEL7.5 and RHEL7.6
libvirt sends VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_ID_DEVICE_REMOVED event too soon (before it has finished tearing down the device's resources and objects)
mode="host-model" VMs include broken "arch-facilities" flag name [libvirt]
Missing librbd1 dependecy for libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd is causing problem with RHEL host upgrade
Garbled output on memory locking failure
libvirtd encountered sigsegv due to null pointer in virJSONValueObjectHasKey()
CVE-2019-3840 libvirt: NULL pointer dereference after running qemuAgentCommand in qemuAgentGetInterfaces function
libvirt segfaults with vfio-pci hostdev device
Unable to migrate VM's using ceph storage - Unsafe migration: Migration without shared storage is unsafe
libvirtd crash when hotplug 'block' type 'lun' device disk without 'sgio' setting to guest
Cannot passthrough a iscsi lun to vm as a hostdev device
[RHEL 7.7] [libvirt] Backport 07c9d6601 ("qemu: use line breaks in command line args written to log")
Don't emit a log error message  if ovs-vsctl doesn't support a particular statistic type on a vif
RFE: backport upstream patches for polling buffers/caches from balloon driver
Fails to query domjobinfo when do snapshot
Network filters are not honouring explicitly listed parameters for MAC
Attaching a device with a taken address succeeds
'cannot set CPU affinity' error when starting guest
internal error: Failed to parse bitmap '' when starting guest
NULL pointer access in qemuProcessInitCpuAffinity()
